summary: The Survivor Benefits Fairness Act (H.R. 2228) amends Title 38 of the United States Code concerning veterans' benefits. It focuses on adjusting the effective date for reductions and discontinuances of compensation, dependency and indemnity compensation, and pensions administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs. Specifically, it changes the timing of when such changes take effect based on events like marriage, remarriage, or death of the beneficiary. The amendment applies to these events occurring on or after the bill's enactment and the bill is referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs.
